meanings.definition: To straighten or separate crossed limbs or objects.
meanings.sent1: She uncrosses her legs to sit comfortably.
meanings.sent2: He always uncrosses his arms when he feels relaxed.
meanings.sent3: The magician uncrosses the ropes with a swift motion, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle master uncrosses the tangled strings of the knot effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor demonstrates how to uncrosses the arms for a better stretch.

meanings.definition: To remove a crossing or intersection.
meanings.sent1: The road worker uncrosses the wires to clear the path.
meanings.sent2: The traffic officer uncrosses the lanes for smoother flow.
meanings.sent3: The chef uncrosses the spaghetti strands to avoid a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The architect uncrosses the lines on the blueprint for a clearer design.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully uncrosses the branches to prevent them from tangling.

meanings.definition: To undo a crossing or entanglement.
meanings.sent1: She uncrosses the fishing lines to avoid a knot.
meanings.sent2: The cat uncrosses its paws after a playful tangle.
meanings.sent3: The child uncrosses the shoelaces before tying them properly.
meanings.sent4: The hiker uncrosses the twisted vines blocking the trail.
meanings.sent5: The weaver skillfully uncrosses the threads to fix a mistake in the pattern.
